text: The 1946 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1946 college football season. Head coach Phil Sarboe led the team to a 1–5–1 mark in the PCC and 1–6–1 overall. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 27 | USC | Away | 7-13 L | 68,282 |- ! scope="row" | October 5 | Idaho | Home | 32-0 W | 14,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 12 | Washington | Home | 7-21 L | 25,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 19 | Oregon | Away | 0-0 T | 18,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 26 | Oregon State | Home | 12-13 L 1 | 5,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 2 | California | Away | 14-47 L | 30,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 16 | Stanford | Away | 26-27 L | 18,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 30 | Michigan State | Away | 20-26 L | 19,691 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1946 in Washington (state)
